item.title: Backup your Win8 computer to your Synology NAS
item.description: I love my Macbook Pro which I’ve been using now for about 6 years. At work I’m a PC user and lately I acquired a Surface Pro 3 as well.

item.title: Hack: How to mimic a disabled checkbox
item.description: The world is not always as we want it to be :). So from now and then you have to place a nice hack here and there.

item.title: HowTo: Subscribe to Failed TFS Builds
item.description: When you use a build server it is a must to get notified in case of build failures. Microsoft’s Team Foundation server has different possibilities to achieve this: using the Build Notification Tool or through so-called Alerts.

item.title: HowTo: Upgrade RAM of Your Macbook Pro
item.description: Here's a nice video that clearly explains how you can upgrade your Macbook RAM:

item.title: Least Invasive Approach to Gain Root Access on the Nexus One
item.description: For my current Android research project I needed to copy an APK to the /system/app folder. Now for that you need root rights. Well, that shouldn't be a problem, right?

item.title: Android: HowTo Detect Installed SQLite DB Version
item.description: As you might already know, Android comes with a preinstalled SQLite database. This is quite handy because you can rely on it without the need to care about installing a DB along with your application (although you can, standalone, small DB's of course like HSQLDB).

item.title: HowTo: Using VS2010 Web.config Transformations to Bypass SSL Authentication Locally
item.description: Most often when you create WCF webservices you'll want to run them in a secure channel, for instance by using SSL encryption on the transport level.

item.title: More Than Just Synching - Dropbox
item.description: You know Dropbox, right (if not, head on to get it here)? I totally love that tool. I mean, you nearly don't notice its presence and actually that's what I love so much.

item.title: HowTo: MySQL Workbench to Remote Ubuntu Production Server Using SSH Port Forwarding
item.description: Before starting, I'm totally not the Linux command line guru, unfortunately. It feels like years of just using Windows base OS makes you a wizard-click-through guy ;).

item.title: HowTo: Teach Visual Studio to Remember Your TFS Password
item.description: I often now ran into the problem of continuously getting queried for the TFS credentials when connecting to the company's TFS server from my personal notebook.

item.title: HowTo: Install your Android app OTA on your device for testing
item.description: A fundamental thing when developing Android apps but also in general when developing with device emulators is to test your app on real devices. Android makes this easy.

item.title: HowTo: Get an Android app's database from the emulator
item.description: Most apps need a database for storing their data onto the device in a structured form. Android's natively supported DB is SQLite. Now of course if you develop an app you'll probably have the need for inspecting the stored data during development.

item.title: HowTo: Prevent Visual Studio from auto-formatting your jQuery source
item.description: When writing JavaScript code with Visual Studio 2008 it automatically formats your source code when going into a new line or placing the ";" delimiter.

item.title: HowTo: Launch JavaScript after async postback of UpdatePanel
item.description: Assume the scenario where you want to launch a JavaScript function after your UpdatePanel finished to do its async postback. This turns out to actually be quite simple.

item.title: HowTo: Fade out div after some seconds using jQuery
item.description: Today I made a quick change to my blog. I don't know whether many of my readers noticed the possibility of expanding the reading area by clicking on the gray vertical bar which separates the left column with the post content.

item.title: HowTo: Include JavaScript file from JavaScript code
item.description: Recently a colleague asked me on how to add a JavaScript file reference to an HTML document from within JavaScript code. It's actually quite easy.

item.title: HowTo: Changing TFS workitem type from task to bug
item.description: Recently I found a bug while implementing another feature and in order to not forget it, I created a new work item for our Team Foundation bug tracking system.

item.title: HowTo: Getting started with JUnit testing for Liferay portlets with Netbeans (for Eclipse users)
item.description: Besides at work, where I'm developing in .Net using Visual Studio, I'm a heavy Eclipse user. I use it for a lot of things, programming J2ME, J2EE, when developing Java desktop clients (using Eclipse RCP) or even when writing LaTeX documents.

item.title: HowTo: Keep request parameters on validation errors with Spring's SimpleFormController
item.description: I recently had a problem when using Spring's SimpleFormController together with validation. So I posted on StackOverflow, got an answer, that didn't work out so I found a solution and answered to myself :)

item.title: HowTo: Get localized string different from the current culture

item.title: Intel ProSet Wireless tool causing a lot of trouble
item.description: Years ago I installed the Intel ProSet Wireless tool for managing my wireless network connections on my HP Compaq. Initially it worked quite well, but then updating it several times introduced a couple of bugs such as delaying the windows startup time because a related service waited till a certain timeout for proceeding etc.

item.title: HowTo: Make your custom ASP.net server control validatable
item.description: Content validation is a major issue of every application. It is an absolute "must have" to notify the user about invalid data he may have entered.

item.title: Floating figures and tables with Latex
item.description: Latex provides you with a lot of advantages when writing scientific papers. It allows you to fully focus on the content without having to worry to much about the formatting.

item.title: HowTo: Set the assembly binding location

item.title: HowTo: Detect Assembly dependencies at runtime
item.description: I'm currently developing a small project for myself, where I'm trying to build a small plugin framework (for experimenting purposes). In that environment I just came across the problem of detecting an assemblies dependencies at runtime.

item.title: HowTo: Persist viewstate on the server-side
item.description: In our last web project we had some performance issues, mainly caused by the extremely big page viewstate of our asp.net pages. If you then add Ajax capabilities to your site, using UpdatePanels, you really get in trouble.

item.title: HowTo: synchronize Google Calendar with your iPhone
item.description: I'm sure you already tried this before. Well unfortunately there is no existing, pre-installed way for synchronizing your iPhone calendar with your Google Calendar. What you can do is to sync your Outlook calendars with your iPhone, either when attaching it to your Mac, PC or whatever (having iTunes installed of course :) , Apples strategy as usual) or over the Microsoft Exchange account (if you have one).

HowTo: execute a file download from Windows command line
item.description: Under Linux it is often very comfortable to download files quickly from within the shell by typing wget [some URL], especially if you do that from within a script.

item.title: HowTo: Create 'linked tables' in MS Access
item.description: Assume you have to migrate some historical data from an application which used an MS Access database to a new application which uses some other DB system (in my case an Oracle DB).

item.title: Retrieving list of installed applications
item.description: From now and then it happens that you have to reset your workstation, meaning to reformat your hard disk and install everything fresh. In this way you get rid of all the garbage on your PC.

item.title: Posting Source code on Blogger
item.description: When you have a blog (like this here) whose content is dedicated to Computer Science related stuff you will often have to post pieces of source code.
